Settings Help default file-picker latest-version beep-sound use-location use-in-background starting-loc-accuracy Starting GPS accuracy (metres) Acceptable GPS standard deviation for starting workout (only for distance workouts). 
Lower = better accuracy
Higher = faster start speed-sample-count Speedometer sample length (GPS fixes) Measure speed for starting n fixes back.
More fixes = accurate speed
Fewer fixes = quick and responsive speed theme Night mode
MENU…
StrokeRateCoach is a rowing app that beeps at a desired rate per minute - in other words, a metronome.
Simple SPM (Strokes Per Minute) rate setting is supported, as well as complex workouts based on distance, time or stroke count.
StrokeRateCoach will happily beep from the background, so feel free to combine it with other sports apps! Make sure to enable background function in settings. How To…t - Simple beeper Go to 'SPEED DIAL' and enter desired SPM. The beeping starts automatically upon dialing the second digit. Supported SPM rates from 10 to 99.
- Preset workout Go to 'WORKOUTS' or 'HISTORY' and tap the 'PLAY' button of the desired workout. Hint: distance is measured at a straight line from the phase/leg start point - may be unsuitable for tracks with turns. - Speed monitor & control While the beeper is running, two readings are visible in the upper part of the screen: 'Speed' shows your current speed, based on the distance covered for the last few GPS fixes (10 by default). 'Min Speed' shows the current speed warning threshold. If on, it will sound a warning as long as your current speed is below that level. Tap to enable and set minimum speed threshold. - Creating a new workout Tap the menu button ('⋮') while the beeper is stopped, then tap 'Create workout'. Choose 'strokes', 'metres' or 'seconds' for workout unit, enter a workout name and then enter data for all workout legs/phases: 
The first (left hand) field of each phase for phase duration. 
The second (right hand) for SPM rate of that phase. Example: to create a 2000m workout comprising 4 legs of 500m each at 22/24/26/28 SPM, create 4 phases and put '500' in the left hand field for each phase. Then, in the right hand field, put 22 for the first phase, then 24 for the second, 26 for the third and 28 for the fourth phase. About This app created by batyanko, enthusiast rower and android developer. Any questions and feedback welcome, especially bug reports. I read all e-mail ;) E-mail
batyankodev@gmail.com Web
www.batyanko.com Github
github.com/batyanko/stroke-rate-coach License StrokeRateCoach is being developed under the Apache 2.0 license http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 . Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Parts of code from other developers have been used and annotated where necessary. These parts are licensed under either Apache 2.0 or CC BY-SA 3.0 http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0 Privacy Policy The StrokeRateCoach app stores a database with your saved and used workouts (entered workout data including unit, name, description, phase length and rate, as well as creation and use timestamp). This data is not shared with anyone and can be erased at will using the 'delete' (bin) button found next to each workout entry. To enable distance and speed measurement, the StrokeRateCoach app makes temporary use of your precise location. This location information is neither stored on persistent storage nor disclosed to third parties. The StrokeRateCoach app uses no internet connection. Location Access StrokeRateCoach can access your precise location to enable distance-based workouts and speed indication. Do you want to enable location usage? Work in the background and use a notification to access it.
This way you can combine it with other sport apps./n(The Android operating system may still decide to stop the background service though, to free up memory). StrokeRateCoach can beep from the background, so you can combine it with other sport apps. (Using notification to access it). Enable background functionality? About Workout running Hi there! " " Confirm Cancel Agree Disagree Use Location Don't Use Location Enable Disable Necessary for speed measurement and distance workouts.
Custom Beep Sound custom-sound custom-sound-path Engage workout Edit workout Delete workout Details image Backup/Restore You can backup your workout presets by copy / paste.

- To create a backup of all presets, hit CREATE(COPY). All presets will be copied as text, which you can paste in your favorite app (like e-mail or docs/notes).

- To restore a previously created backup, copy the same text from the source you stored it in, then hit RESTORE(PASTE). All backup workouts will be added automatically. CREATE (COPY) from StrokeRateCoach RESTORE (PASTE) to StrokeRateCoach -------
#Copy this whole text to backup/restore StrokeRateCoach workouts
#Workouts are described by several lines. Workouts starting with # are ignored.
#Format:
#1. Title
#2. Description
#3. Type: 0 - strokes, 1 - meters, 2 - seconds.
#4. Strokes per minute for each phase
#5. Duration of each phase (in strokes, metres or seconds).
-------

Hooray! Now available:

- Workout edit, copy and backup.
- Alternative beep sounds (try if default beep doesn't work). COPY RESTORE TO PRESETS
